COLORADO CITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION
==============================================

**COLORADO CITY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION MEMBERS  
  
Raymond Whitener  -  President  
Jeremy Rivera  -  Vice President  
Stan Neff  -  Secretary  
Cliff Shiller - EDC Member  
Brian Younger - EDC Member  
James Farquhar - EDC Member  
Andrea Burleson - EDC Member  
  
Colorado City Economic Development Board meets every first Thursday of the month at 6:00 p.m. at the Civic Center located at 157 W. 2nd St., Colorado City, Texas 79512.  
  
[Colorado City Economic Development Website](https://coloradocityedc.com/)  
  
PROGRAM  
FACADE IMPROVEMENT GRANT  
  
The Colorado City Economic Development Corporation has adopted a Façade Improvement Grant Project.  Under this project, property owners may apply for and receive grants to add upgrades and enhancements and perform repairs to the façade of their buildings.  Eligible property owners may be reimbursed for fifty percent (50%) of the costs of eligible façade improvements, up to a maximum reimbursement of $10,000.00.  
  
[LINK](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/Resolution%202022%20-01%20Facade%20Grant.pdf)  
[APPLICATION](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/CCEDC%20Facade%20Improvement%20Grant%202020-2021.pdf)  
  
  
PROGRAM  
E-COMMERCE ACCELERATOR INCENTIVE PROGRAM  
  
The Colorado City Economic Development Corporation has adopted an E-Commerce Accelerator Incentive Program to encourage small businesses within the City of Colorado City, Texas to diversify by establishing and promoting e-commerce sales to complement their brick-and-mortar storefront for the retail and service industry.  
  
[LINK](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/E-COMMERCE%20ACCELERATOR%20INCENTIVE%20PROGRAM.pdf)  
[APPLICATION](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/TARGETED%20BUSINESS%20INCENTIVE%20APPLICATION.pdf)  
  
  
PROGRAM  
RETAILER AND COMMERCIAL TENANT IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM  
  
The Colorado City Economic Development Corporation has adopted the Retailer and Commercial Tenant Improvement (TI) Program to help grow a vibrant and thriving business climate in Colorado City.  This program will support new and expanding businesses within the corporate city limits of Colorado City.  
  
[LINK](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/RETAILER%20AND%20COMMERCIAL%20TENANT%20IMPROVEMENT%20PROGRAM.pdf)  
[APPLICATION](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/TARGETED%20BUSINESS%20INCENTIVE%20APPLICATION.pdf)  
  
  
HISTORICAL PRESERVATION PROGRAM**  
 **The City of Colorado City has adopted Ordinance 2021-25 - Providing for the designation of Historic Resources and Historic Districts; creating the requirement of obtaining a certificate of appropriateness or demolition permit; providing for tax incentives; providing for the enforcement thereof.  
  
[LINK](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/Ordinance%202021%20-%2025%20Historical%20Preservation.pdf)  
[APPLICATION](https://www.coloradocitytexas.org/Historical%20Application%20-%20Exhibit%20B..pdf)  
  
  
\*\*MISSION STATEMENT\*\*  
  
Our mission is to create a strong foundation for conducting business recruitment, retention, and expansion. Our focus is to maintain positive relationships with current business owners and help improve quality of life for the citizens of Colorado City.  
  
  
  
COLORADO CITY - CHAPTER 380 AGREEMENTS  
  
[CHAPTER 380 AGREEMENTS](https://comptroller.texas.gov/economy/development/grants/ch380-381/)**
